snippet: Researchers in the Outer Banks of North Carolina have equipped a rugged vehicle with radar and lidar to study why storms cause especially severe erosion in some areas.
abstract: Researchers studying the Outer Banks of North Carolina have invented a tool for measuring storm damage in a surf zone where waves crest and break and crash on the shore; robust tool, Coastal Lidar and Radar Imaging System, is essentially a Sno-Cat fitted with both radar sensors and a lidar instrument, which uses light detection to produce highly accurate maps of beach topography.
lead_paragraph: Researchers in the Outer Banks of North Carolina have equipped a rugged vehicle with radar and lidar to study why storms cause especially severe erosion in some areas.
